item.title: Learn Ruby on Rails Best Practices With One Exercise
item.description: You want to write smooth professional-loooking code. You’re craving some squeaky-clean code. But all you have for lunch every day is a big bowl of legacy spaghetti code. You consider yourself a decent developer, but you’re never sure how to organize a project. How to name things. Where some piece of business logic should live. How can you become a Ruby on Rails expert if the code you read everyday stinks?
